DOC.HEADLINE: YOUTH COULD BE 1ST UNDER NEW RULING TO FACE MURDER_CHARGES IN DEATH OF FETUS
DOC.TEXT: In what may be the first case of its kind in California , a Fresno teen-ager could be charged with murder in connection with the shooting death of his girlfriend ' s fetus . The 4-month fetus died Friday , a day after Ramon Orosco , 18 , shot his 14-year-old pregnant girlfriend in the back for talking with another boy , police said.Maria Torres was listed in extremely critical condition at Fresno ' s Valley Medical_Center . Assistant Dist . Atty . Robert Freed said Orosco will be charged with murder . Because of a state Supreme Court ruling in May , the killing of a non-viable fetus can be considered murder . Previously , the court held that a murder_charge was warranted only if the fetus was old enough to survive at birth .
